article.Heading: Union Budget 2017-18: Twitterati pokes gentle fun as Jaitley presents Budget
article.Summary: The finance minister got some good-natured stick for lengthy speech.
article.Body:
Moneycontrol Bureau

As Finance Minister Arun Jaitley delivered his Budget speech in Parliament on Wednesday, Indians on Twitter were taking note of his every word with a view to producing their humourous best.

While the Finance Minister infused some humour of his own with a few couplets and talking about how the number of vehicle buyers and foreign travelers exceeded the number of taxpayers, social media poked fun at the length of his speech and some of his proposals.

Here’s a selection of tweets on the Budget.

Jaitley didn't mention the sluggish IRCTC website, but didn't get away with it

No service charges on tickets booked on IRCTC. No mention of compensation for trauma undergone for surviving the site & Tatkal. #Budget2017

— Deepanjana (@dpanjana) February 1, 2017
The poor honest taxpayer. Never anything in it for him...


Reaction of honest tax payers after watching every #Budget in India. #Budget2017 pic.twitter.com/Dk8WOTn0xV

— The-Lying-Lama (@KyaUkhaadLega) February 1, 2017
